content: hilbre by gill slater hilbre is the name of an island which is situated in the estuary between north wales and england at low tide it is possible to walk to the island there is a small medieval chapel built there dedicated to st hildeburgh it is thought that this is how the island got its name hilbre is a triangular shawl for those days when something cosy is required to keep you warm from the breeze the shawl is knitted flat from one point increasing along the wingspan edge until the width of the border is reached the beautiful lace panel provides eye-catching detail whilst the stocking stitch panel provides you with its familiar warmth hilbre © 2020 gill slater page 1 yarn abbreviations 5 x 50g 135m rowan softyak dk sample cm centimetres shown is in shade 247 shell k
